intro: Aconitum napellus f. pubescens, commonly known as the pubescent monkshood, is a variant of the European monkshood. It is a perennial herbaceous plant native to the mountainous regions of Europe. The plant features striking purple to blue flowers arranged in a spire-like inflorescence. Its leaves are palmately lobed with a distinctive hooded flower structure. The pubescent form is characterized by a hairy texture on its stems and leaves, distinguishing it from the typical variety.
